node.title: The Story of a Craft Beer Pioneer
node.description: “The Dogfish Head Book” by the brewery founders Sam and Mariah Calagione, and written with Andrew C. Greeley, recounts 26 years of beer adventures.

node.title: Dozens of 'Extremely Hungry' Cats, Including One With Broken Leg, Rescued From Hoarder
node.description: The Humane Society of Weld County estimated that the medical costs for all the animals would amount to thousands of dollars.

node.title: Man Wins Lottery 20 Times After Purchasing 20 Identical Tickets
node.description: "It feels good, no doubt about it!" said the winner to Virginia Lottery officials.

node.title: Russian Officials Look at Extending Off-Work Periods as COVID Cases Continue to Rise
node.description: Russia reported more than 40,000 new confirmed COVID-19 cases and more than 1,100 deaths on Monday for the seventh day in a row.

node.title: Video Shows Deli Worker Narrowly Escaping Molotov Cocktail
node.description: The suspect attempted to throw a second incendiary device but was stopped by a person standing outside the business.

node.title: Christchurch housing remains affordable despite rising prices
node.description: After years of slow growth, property prices in Christchurch are all of a sudden surging ahead and fast catching up with the rest of the country.

node.title: Supermarket inquiry: Foodstuffs, Woolworths deny holding duopoly
node.description: The two major supermarket chains say consumers will have to pay higher prices and the country's investment reputation will be damaged if another big operator comes in.

node.title: Kobe Bryant estate reportedly gains $400M in BodyArmor sale
node.description: Coca-Cola bought the remaining stake in sports drink BodyArmor, including the 10% once owned by Kobe Bryant.

node.title: Tiny Bubbles on the Walls
node.description: La Fête du Champagne returns with an immersive experience that takes wine lovers on a journey through how Champagne is made.

node.title: The Best Places to Watch the New York City Marathon
node.description: It has become the city’s biggest block party. Here’s where to cheer for the 33,000 runners in every borough.

node.title: Peking Duck With Added Fire
node.description: Hutong has added a flaming Peking duck to its menu in limited supply.

node.title: State Prison Workers in U.S. are Quitting in Droves and It Isn't Just Because of COVID
node.description: "There are dozens of reasons to leave and very few to stay," said Brian Dawe, national director of the nonprofit organization One Voice United.

node.title: Capitol Rioter Who Bragged She 'Made History,' Said 'Civil War' Was Coming After January 6
node.description: Prosecutors said they are pushing for a 30-day incarceration for Rasha Abual-Ragheb because of her "violent rhetoric" before, during and after the riot.

node.title: 'Offensive' Shakespeare Parody Play Prompts Teacher's Suspension
node.description: Students allege that the teacher was upset by their concerns and decided to cancel the play rather than put it on with their suggested revisions.

node.title: Large U.S. Companies to Be Required to Provide Paid Time Off For COVID-19 Vaccinations, Recovery
node.description: OSHA's proposed policy will require companies to provide their employees with paid time off to receive a COVID-19 vaccine and recover from vaccine side effects.

node.title: As Border Patrol Agents Resist Vaccines, Fear Mounts Staffing Issues Could Hurt Security
node.description: Lawmakers who have co-signed Tony Gonzales' letter say any lapse in CBP staffing could overwhelm the agency and allow more people to enter the U.S. illegally.

node.title: Virginia Governor's Race, Replacing Minneapolis Police: Key Votes to Watch on Tuesday
node.description: Tuesday's Election Day will see several highly-contested races decided across the country.

node.title: Virginia Election Tests Democrats' Anti-Trump Message Ahead of 2022 Midterm Battles
node.description: Democrats will be fighting to keep their party's slim majorities in both chambers of Congress during next fall's midterm elections.

node.title: Black Ferns Sevens skipper signs with Hurricanes
node.description: Black Ferns Sevens Olympic gold medal winning captain signs with her home franchise for next year's inaugural Super Rugby Aupiki competition.

node.title: Amazon to Launch First Two Internet Satellites in 2022
node.description: Competing with SpaceX, OneWeb and others, the e-commerce titan will rely on small rockets to get prototypes of its satellite constellation into space.

node.title: A Jam Maker Turns to Tea
node.description: Bonne Maman now carries five herbal tea blends, perfect for a scone slathered in preserves.

node.title: An Uncommon Rise for Bread
node.description: Jenny Bardwell explains how to salt-rise bread in a virtual talk for the Culinary Historians of New York.

node.title: Baltimore Ravens' Malik Harrison Wounded in Cleveland Shooting Halloween Night
node.description: The team announced the linebacker suffered a "non-life-threatening injury" while visiting his home state over the weekend.

node.title: Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade Makes a Comeback, Adds Baby Yoda to Famed Balloon Lineup
node.description: The parade will once again allow viewers and balloon holders in New York City to participate in the parade after last year's celebration was limited.

node.title: Man fined for allegedly punching flight attendant now faces charges
node.description: A federal grand jury in Seattle indicted a man accused of punching a flight attendant in the face twice and trying to open the cockpit door late last year during a flight from Hawaii to Washington state.

node.title: A Close Look at My Day of the Dead Altar
node.description: Mexico’s Day of the Dead is one of the country’s most important celebrations, with ofrendas, or altars, to honor loved ones who have died a central tradition. Here’s a look at mine.

node.title: Subway Scenes: Halloween Returns With a Vengeance
node.description: Lanternflies, mushrooms and container ships: Costumed riders came back to haunt New York City’s underground during one of the city’s most celebrated holidays.

node.title: Dr. Aaron T. Beck, Developer of Cognitive Therapy, Dies at 100
node.description: It was an answer to Freudian analysis: a pragmatic, thought-monitoring approach to treating anxiety, depression and other mental disorders, and it changed psychiatry.

node.title: Drake Earns a Fifth Week at No. 1 Ahead of Music’s Major Fall Releases
node.description: With new albums by Ed Sheeran, Taylor Swift and Adele looming, the rapper’s “Certified Lover Boy” remains atop the Billboard chart.

node.title: Over 1.1 Million Early Votes Cast in Virginia Governor's Race, McAuliffe Claims Advantage
node.description: Democratic former Governor Terry McAuliffe claims to have a "big lead on the early vote," although polling shows the opposite.

node.title: Timeline of Squid Game Crypto Collapsing As Developers Vanish With $2.1m
node.description: The token, inspired by but not affiliated with the popular Netflix show, had been flagged as risky before its crash.

node.title: Biden Expected to Offer Powell 2nd Term as Fed Chair Tries to Maintain Economic Recovery
node.description: Powell's term is set to expire in early February, but former presidents have announced decisions on re-nomination by late summer or early fall.

node.title: ArborGen sells Oceania business with aims for overseas expansion
node.description: Tree seedling producer ArborGen has sold its Australia and New Zealand business, with the company eyeing up expansion in its United States and South American business.

node.title: 'Choking story is not the reality' - Crown argues in manslaughter case
node.description: A woman, who allegedly died at the hands of a man on trial for her manslaughter, was found to have suffered 76 injuries, a court has been told.

node.title: Let's Get Wellington Moving project offers four options for public transport
node.description: Faster commuting in the capital is one step closer with the release of four options for mass rapid transit under the multibillion-dollar Let's Get Wellington Moving project.

node.title: Wall Street not sold on Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse push
node.description: Facebook's plan to build a new digital world could prove either a bold step into the future or a massive financial folly.

node.title: The Novavax vaccine, backed by Operation Warp Speed, has won its first authorization — in Indonesia.
node.description: After months of production delays, this is the first vaccine authorization for Novavax and its manufacturing partner, the Serum Institute of India.

node.title: What is Ex Parte Young, much-discussed in the Texas abortion case?
node.description: The 1908 case held that state officials could be sued in federal court to prevent them from enforcing unconstitutional laws.

node.title: The Biden administration will publish vaccine mandate rules ‘in the coming days.’
node.description: The Labor Department has completed a draft of an emergency standard, which is under review. When it is released, a flurry of corporate vaccine mandates is expected to follow.

node.title: Arizona Man Loses Mom, Sister, Aunt, Cousin, Niece to COVID in Just 10 Days
node.description: "It's a tragedy. I don't even know what to say anymore," said Jason Bennett from Tempe, Arizona.

node.title: Judge Removed From Office After Allegedly Saying George Floyd 'Got What He Deserved'
node.description: An Alabama judge accused of making racist and offensive comments in the workplace was removed from office.

node.title: Trump, Biden Have Nearly Same Favorability Rating, New Poll Finds
node.description: An NBC News survey found that 40 percent of those surveyed had a positive view of Biden, down from the 43 percent he had in August.

node.title: Woman dies trying to swim across U.S. border in San Diego
node.description: Border Patrol said agents took 36 Mexican nationals into custody, including 13 people who were pulled from the water by the U.S. Coast Guard.

node.title: Southwest probing pilot's use of anti-Biden phrase on speaker system
node.description: An AP reporter who was on the flight said there was an "audible gasp" from some passengers when the pilot said "Let's go, Brandon."

node.title: How to watch the 2021 election results
node.description: Polls close at 7 p.m. in Virginia and at 8 p.m. in New Jersey.
